funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship, covering full tuition fees (fee offset), living allowance/stipend, and research support. The stipend is approximately AUD 37,000 per year (2024 rate) for up to 2 years for Master's students and 3.5 years for PhD students, or AUD 38,500 per year (2025 full-time study rate) for Master's by Research students.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Available to high-achieving domestic and international students undertaking a Masters by Research degree or doctoral degree (PhD) at the University of Melbourne. Applicants must be enrolling in a graduate research degree or currently enrolled in a research course. Selection is based on academic results for prior study and research potential.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Almost all academic fields and research areas, including Accounting, Agriculture, Architecture, Psychology, Built environment, Business and management, Communications, Computing and information.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Academic merit is a key factor. Unofficial guidance suggests a Weighted Average Mark (WAM) of around 80 for admission, at least 85 for scholarship for domestic students, and around 90 for international students. A minimum GPA of 3.6 has also been mentioned for Master's scholarships.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Masters by Research degree or Doctoral degree (PhD)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant work experience, research experience, awards, conference presentations, industry work, internships, relevant publications (refereed journal articles).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Minimum English Language requirements: IELTS: 7.0 (Written: 7.0; no band less than 6.0); TOEFL: 94+ (Writing: 27; Speaking: 18; Reading & Listening: 13). Other accepted tests include Pearson English test, Cambridge English, Certificate of Advanced English (CAE).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Academic references are required and must be provided in accordance with instructions in the online application form.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Prior completion of a degree at the same level as the intended research course. Demonstrated research potential in their field of study. Build an Academic CV.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic Referee Report, Academic CV, relevant publications.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: University officials shortlist and select candidates based on academic merit, academic results for prior study, research potential, work experience, and completion of a relevant degree. Candidates are ranked highest by relevant selection panels.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Melbourne Research Scholarship (MRS) is supported by the Australian Commonwealth Government and offered by the University of Melbourne. It is often referred to interchangeably with Graduate Research Scholarships and Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarships. Graduate Research Scholarships that provide a stipend and fee offset are awarded based on academic merit. Domestic students typically receive a Research Training Program Scholarship (Fee Offset) with their course offer, while stipend and fee offset offers are made separately but around the same time.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: New applicants are automatically considered for Graduate Research Scholarships when applying for a graduate research course by the deadline. Current students seeking a scholarship must apply online by the stated deadline.

basic_info.official_name: University of Sydney Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarships
basic_info.provider: Australian Government (funded through the University of Sydney)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded. The Australian Government provides funding to eligible Higher Education Providers (HEPs) through the RTP to support their training of domestic and overseas students undertaking research doctorate and research masters degrees. RTP Scholarships include RTP Fees Offset, RTP Stipends and RTP Allowances. The scholarship is very competitive and awarded to approximately 30 students each year.

timeline_info.application_deadline: September 12, 2025 (for Research Period 1 and 2); May 5, 2025 (for Research Period 3 & 4); December 30, 2025 (general closing date for some applications)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Available to domestic and international postgraduate research students. Applicants must be enrolled in an accredited Research Higher Degree (HDR) at the University of Sydney. Awarded to students of exceptional research potential to undertake a higher degree by research. Must meet English language proficiency requirements. Students are required to show exceptional academic performance and strong research potential. Must apply and be considered for the Research Training Program (RTP) Stipend Scholarships. Eligible to undertake a Postgraduate Research Degree or Master’s by Research program.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All fields of study leading to a higher degree by research (research doctorate or research masters degrees) offered at the University of Sydney.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Very good grades; exceptional academic performance.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Completion of relevant prior degree: Bachelor's for Master's applicants, Master's for PhD applicants. Must be undertaking a higher degree by research (HDR).

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of 6 months of relevant supervised research experience.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant supervised research experience with outstanding results (perhaps as part of a Masters degree). Authorship of a peer-reviewed journal paper that has been accepted for publication in a well-regarded journal. Published book/literature review or a published research report/case study. Refereed publications (not conference proceedings). Publications or outputs that are not more than five years old.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Must meet English language proficiency standards established by the University. Specific tests or scores are not mentioned in the provided content.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Strong referee letters, preferably from academics who worked with the applicant on research.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Something to make the applicant stand out, such as authorship of a peer-reviewed journal paper or having won notable prizes and commendations in academic studies. Applicants may be offered a conditional Scholarship without having yet received an admission offer but will only receive a firm scholarship offer once they have received an unconditional admission offer. An application for admission to a research degree must be submitted. All required documents for both the program application and the RTP scholarship application must be submitted.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Research Experience Evidence Template (RE Form). All required documents for both the program application and the RTP scholarship application.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are assessed on academic merit. Universities are responsible for the application, selection, and offer process for RTP scholarships.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Research Training Program (RTP) scholarships provide financial assistance to domestic and international postgraduate research students enrolled in or undertaking a higher degree by research at the University of Sydney. Funded by the Australian government. Scholarships are awarded to students of exceptional research potential. RTP scholarships are available for a minimum of 3 years and up to a maximum of 4 years for full-time research doctorate students, and for a minimum of 6 years up to a maximum of 8 years for part-time research doctorate students.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Outcomes will be notified by 24 June 2025 for applications submitted by 5 May 2025. Refer to the RTP Application and Award Timeline on the official website for full details.

funding_info.funding_details: Prestigious, fully funded postgraduate scholarship, covering the full cost of studying at Cambridge.

timeline_info.application_deadline: US Citizens: October 15, 2025 (or October each year). Other Applicants: December 3, 2025 OR January 7, 2026 (varies based on proposed course, or January each year).
timeline_info.opening_date: September each year (e.g., September 3 or September 10)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be from countries outside the UK, pursuing a full-time postgraduate degree at the University of Cambridge. They should be seniors or recent college graduates. Academic excellence is required, with minimum GPA requirements varying (e.g., 3.5, 3.8, average 3.7-4.0). Applicants must meet Cambridge admission requirements and English language proficiency. Candidates should normally be under the age of 30. Financial need is not a requirement. Current Cambridge students applying for a new postgraduate course, or current Gates Cambridge Scholars applying for a new degree, are eligible. However, those already part-way through a course cannot apply to fund the remainder of it.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Any subject available at the University of Cambridge, including sciences, humanities, and social sciences.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA requirements vary by source (e.g., 3.5, 3.8), with an average of 3.7-4.0. Specific GPA is determined by individual graduate programs at Cambridge.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Postgraduate degree (Master's, MPhil, PhD, or short courses). MPhil programs are typically one year, PhDs three to four years. A pilot scheme allows for part-time doctoral degrees.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience is not a mandatory requirement. However, experience is considered as part of academic excellence criteria.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Required if English is not first language. Typically IELTS/TOEFL. Specific scores mentioned: IELTS 7.5 (with 7.0 in all components) or TOEFL Internet 110 (with 25 or higher in all components).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Requires references, including a specific 'Gates Cambridge Reference' and typically 2 academic references.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Research Proposal (for PhD applicants). Candidates are assessed on their 'fit' and commitment to improving lives.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: A pilot scheme allows applicants to apply for funding for a part-time doctoral degree (PhD).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Selection is based on four criteria: Academic excellence, Reasons for choice of course, a commitment to improving the lives of others, and leadership potential. Applicants must be admitted to Cambridge. Application is via the University's Graduate Application Portal.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application submitted via University of Cambridge's Graduate Application Portal, including sections for course admission, college place, and Gates Cambridge funding. Required documents include transcripts, references (including a specific Gates Cambridge Reference), and a Research Proposal for PhD applicants. An online form (PDF) and writing components are also mentioned.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants apply through the University of Cambridge's Graduate Application Portal. Selection is based on four criteria: academic excellence, reasons for choice of course, commitment to improving lives, and leadership potential. Shortlisted candidates are invited for a 20-30 minute interview (in-person or virtual), which often focuses on the proposed research work.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in October 2000 by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. The first class of scholars began in October 2001. Its mission is to build a global network of future leaders committed to improving the lives of others.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship. Offers a living allowance (stipend) of $36,063 (AUD) per year, or $35,013 (AUD) per year, and a relocation allowance if eligible. Covers tuition fees, living allowance, relocation, and research costs.

timeline_info.application_deadline: International Round 1: 31 March 2025; Domestic Round 2: 31 May 2025; 2025-2026 round: 31 October 2025
timeline_info.opening_date: International Round 1: 1 September 2025; Domestic Round 2: 1 November; Domestic Round 4: 1 June
timeline_info.number_of_awards: The number of scholarships offered varies.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to both domestic and international students pursuing Research Master's or PhD degrees. Selection is based on academic record, research outputs, and prior research experience. Current Monash students can apply. Must maintain a Weighted Average Mark (WAM) of 70 each semester.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All academic fields, including Arts, Engineering, Law, Medicine, Business, and more.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (at least four years of full-time study in a relevant field, or equivalent to an honors 1 or 2A) for entry into Research Master's or PhD degrees.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS overall score of 6.5 (no band less than 6.0); TOEFL overall score of 79+ (with specific scores for sections). Specific English language requirements apply for master’s and doctoral research degrees.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation from academic or professional mentors.
additional_requirements.age_limits: There is no specific age limit.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Letter of motivation, candidate publications/research outputs.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Passport, transcripts, research proposal, reference letters, information about work experience and research experience, letter of motivation, candidate publications/research outputs.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Highly competitive, based on academic record, research outputs, and prior research experience.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Monash Graduate Scholarship (MGS) is offered by Monash University to support domestic and international students undertaking Research Master’s and PhD programs at Australian campuses. It is a centrally controlled, fully funded scholarship.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Multiple application rounds annually. Key submission and outcome dates are available, with domestic rounds opening in November and June.

funding_info.funding_details: The UCL-RES scholarship consists of full fees (either Home or Overseas) plus a maintenance stipend which increases each year with inflation. The scholarship also includes additional research costs of up to £1,200 per year for the stated duration of the research portion of the programme.
covered_expenses: Additional research costs (up to £1,200 per year)

timeline_info.opening_date: now open for the 2025-26 academic year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding scholars from any country, both prospective and current UCL doctoral students. Candidates must undertake a full programme of doctoral research at UCL, either full-time or part-time. Applicants must have submitted a completed admission application to, or currently be registered on, an eligible degree programme at UCL by the scholarship deadline. An offer of a place at UCL is not required to apply for the scholarship, but a complete UCL research application must be submitted.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: MPhil/PhD or EngD students in any discipline offered by UCL
field_restrictions.restrictions: excluding some programs (specific programs not detailed)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: First class or a very good second class honours degree or their equivalent

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS: 6.5 overall (minimum 6.0 in each section); TOEFL: 92 overall (general UCL requirement)

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Referees should show personal knowledge of the candidate, demonstrate outstanding promise and research potential, and confirm the candidate has obtained or is predicted to obtain a first class or a very good second class honours degree or their equivalent.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Candidates submit UCL-RES applications directly to the academic department they have applied to (or are currently enrolled in for current UCL PhD students). Departments can only submit two applicants in total, unless submitting for UCL-China Scholarship Council (CSC) Research Scholarships.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: UCL's Research Excellence Scholarship (UCL-RES) aims to attract outstanding scholars from any country, to undertake a full programme of doctoral research at UCL. For the 2025/26 academic year, 40 fully funded UCL Research Excellence Scholarships (UCL-RES) are offered to exceptional applicants from any country.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The scholarship is now open for the 2025-26 academic year. Conflicting application deadlines are mentioned: 9th January 2026 (general closing date), 24 October 2025 (another stated deadline), and departmental applications by 23 November 2025 for September 2026 entry.

basic_info.provider: Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR), Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada (NSERC), and Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council (SSHRC) (federal program)

timeline_info.application_deadline: Institutional deadlines vary: e.g., September 24, 2025 (uOttawa), September 9, 2025, at 12:00PM PT (UBC), November 21st (CIHR via institution with quota). Direct to SSHRC: October 17, 2025 (8:00 p.m. eastern). Applicants must contact their institution for specific deadlines, which are often significantly earlier than the agency’s deadline.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 458 doctoral scholarships awarded (historical data from SSHRC)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident of Canada or Protected Person under subsection 95(2) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (Canada) by the application deadline. Up to 15% of awards across Canada are available to international applicants; if not a Canadian citizen/PR/Protected Person, you must be enrolled in your doctoral program of study at an eligible Canadian institution by the application deadline. Applicants must be registered in a degree program (e.g., U of T degree program at any time between January 1- December 31 in the year of application, or on an approved leave of absence). An eligible doctoral program must be predominantly research oriented, leading to the completion of a thesis, major research project, dissertation, or scholarly work. Applicants must have completed no more than 36 months of full-time equivalent study in the doctoral program (or the PhD portion of a joint professional undergraduate/PhD program or joint program like MA/PhD, MSc/PhD, MBA/PhD) for which funding is requested by December 31 of the calendar year of application. A maximum of one Canada Graduate Research Scholarship – Master's (CGRS M) or Canada Graduate Research Scholarship – Doctoral (CGRS D) application can be submitted. Applications must be submitted through the correct channel (either through a Canadian institution with a doctoral award quota or directly to the relevant agency).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Applicants apply to the agency best aligned with their research subject matter: CIHR (all areas of health research, biomedical research, clinical research, health services research), NSERC (natural science or engineering disciplines), or SSHRC (implied social sciences and humanities).

academic_requirements.required_degree: Doctoral program (implies prior degree for admission to doctoral studies)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant work experience can be discussed in the application, highlighting its relevance to the proposed field of study or research and any benefits gained.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: While there is no specific language requirement, candidates must possess sufficient proficiency in English or French to undertake doctoral studies.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Referees are required, but the specific number is not stated.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Students on an approved leave of absence are eligible to apply.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Appropriate agency’s online application form, Request for First Instalment Form, official transcripts (including original transcripts for transfer credits), free-form documents, proposed research description (must align with agency’s mandate), and a section to discuss relevant work experience.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Awards are granted through national competitions by the three federal granting agencies. Most Canadian degree-granting institutions receive a quota for the number of applications they can submit to the national competition.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Canada Graduate Research Scholarship—Doctoral program is a federal program that recognizes and supports the next generation of outstanding innovators, knowledge workers, creative thinkers, and researchers. It provides support for a high-quality research training experience to foster impacts within and beyond the research environment, promoting Canadian research excellence.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded postgraduate award for 2-3 years of study.
covered_expenses: Travel expenses to and from the UK
Fee required to apply to study at the University of Oxford

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by constituency. For 2026 entry, deadlines are typically in July, August, or October 2025. Examples include: 2 June 2025 (most constituencies), 31 July 2025 (Global), 28 August 2025 (West Africa), 31 August 2025 (Global), 15 August (Canada). Campus endorsement deadlines are often earlier (e.g., June 15, 2025 for USC, August 1, 2025 for Cornell/Duke).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varies by constituency. 32 for the United States. Other examples: Canada (11), Australia (9), India (6), China (4), West Africa (3), Global (2), Bermuda (1), Commonwealth Caribbean (1).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from specific constituencies (countries/regions). Eligibility varies by constituency but generally requires citizenship or permanent residency of the relevant country. US applicants can be citizens, permanent residents (for 5+ years), or DACA recipients. Selection is made without regard to gender. Applicants must be admitted to Oxford University for the scholarship to be conferred. Inter-Jurisdictional Consideration may be available for those with strong connections to multiple constituencies but not meeting nationality/citizenship criteria for one.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Most full-time postgraduate courses in almost any field offered by Oxford University.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Postdoctoral awards are available in natural and physical science disciplines only.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 3.7 GPA (for US applicants/institutional endorsement), though successful applicants typically have 3.8 or higher.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree required before admission to Oxford; scholarship is for master's and PhD studies.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Required. Must meet Oxford's English language requirements, typically IELTS minimum 7.5 or TOEFL iBT 110.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Between 5-8 letters of recommendation (e.g., 5-8 for US, 6 for Canada). At least four should be from undergraduate instructors; others should speak to character.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Candidates should describe immediate plans upon completion of the scholarship and how two years at Oxford would enhance these plans (max 150 words).
additional_requirements.age_limits: Typically 18-23 years old on October 1st of the application year (e.g., born after Oct 1, 2001 and before Oct 2, 2007 for 2026 entry). Some constituencies may allow up to age 24, or under 27 for US citizens with specific conditions.
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: Selection is made without regard to gender.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: DACA students are eligible to apply for the US Rhodes. Inter-Jurisdictional Consideration is available for applicants with strong connections to multiple constituencies but not meeting nationality/citizenship criteria for one.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Institutional endorsement is required for US, Canada, and Global Rhodes applicants. It is highly recommended to contact Oxford degree programs/faculty to demonstrate commitment. Personal Statement must be wholly truthful and the applicant's own work, with no assistance received. Applicants should develop a broad perspective on their area of study.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Contact information, evidence of eligibility, university transcripts, proposed Oxford course(s), CV, Academic Statement, Personal Statement, 5-8 letters of recommendation, proof of citizenship/permanent residence, list of principal activities, clear headshot photograph, Post Scholarship Plan, institutional endorsement, evidence of English Language Proficiency.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Involves multiple rounds of interviews, including preliminary interviews (often in person) and individual interviews. Interview questions are based on the personal statement and may include behavioral questions. Institutional endorsement is a key step before final selection.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A life-changing postgraduate opportunity for talented young people from around the world to study full-time at the University of Oxford, aiming to gather young leaders.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Rhodes Scholars enter Oxford University in October of the year following election. The scholarship funds 2-3 years of study.

basic_info.provider: Commonwealth Scholarship Commission (CSC) in the UK; UK Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded. Funded by the UK Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO).

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varied between 81 and 200 awards annually, with an average of 128 awards per year for PhD Scholarships.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be citizens of Commonwealth countries, specifically from least developed countries and vulnerable states (as classified by the OECD Development Assistance Committee (DAC)). They must have been living in an eligible Commonwealth country for a period of two years prior to application submission. Applicants should demonstrate the potential to contribute to the sustainable development of their home countries and a commitment to development. The scholarships are aimed at those who could not otherwise afford to study in the UK and are for full-time doctoral study at a UK university. Applicants must be eligible to begin a UK PhD program.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Science and technology for development; Improving population health, health systems and capacity; Science and technology; Health; Innovation; Peace; Resilience; Access, inclusion & opportunity.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Research must align with one of the six CSC development themes.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: No specified minimum GPA, but excellent academic standing is mandatory. A minimum score of 60 out of 100 in HAT test (specific to HEC Pakistan). Must have a 2.1 undergraduate degree or a 2.2 undergraduate degree with a postgraduate degree (like a Masters).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree (or equivalent qualification) or a relevant master's qualification is typically required. Must hold a relevant degree.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Must meet English language requirements, such as IELTS, TOEFL, or equivalent. IELTS: minimum overall score of 6.5. TOEFL: minimum overall score of 92. PTE is also mentioned.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: At least two references (in letterhead and signed) are required. Applications with outstanding reference letters will not be considered.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Applicants should demonstrate the potential to make a positive development impact in their home countries and contribute to sustainable development.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Applicants older than 38 years of age at the time of application are ineligible.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must have gotten at least two admissions from UK Universities. A supporting statement from a UK Supervisor is required for PhD candidates. Applicants are required to list three potential supervisors from three different UK universities. The CSC does not accept direct applications for these scholarships. Applicants must print out their completed application form before submitting it. A detailed academic CV is required. Admission letters are required where applicable.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed application form, at least two admissions from UK Universities, at least two references (in letterhead and signed), supporting statement from UK Supervisor, detailed academic CV, admission letters (where required).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The CSC will notify applicants who have been provisionally selected (selected for an award subject to the CSC agreeing terms of admission to the university). Shortlisted candidates are part of the process.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Commonwealth PhD Scholarships are for full-time doctoral study at a UK university, beginning in September/October 2026. They are a UK government scholarship scheme led by international development objectives, aiming to enhance individual teaching and research capacity and increase institutional capacity in Commonwealth countries. They also contribute to UK higher education by attracting high-calibre international applicants and encouraging links and collaboration.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are for study in the UK beginning in September/October 2026, for the 2026/2027 academic year.

funding_info.funding_details: Support for the program is for a period of five years. Students will be fully funded for four years, including all university fees, and will receive a generous starting stipend of £19.9K per year. Four year’s student’s stipend, as set by the Wellcome Trust. In total the Wellcome Trust awarded £127M funding to support 23 new PhD programmes across the UK.
covered_expenses: Student Visa and Immigration Health Surcharge costs
up to £1500 per year can be provided for students

timeline_info.application_deadline: Thursday 27 November 2025 (Wellcome Sanger Institute); 4 August 2025 (Exeter GW4CAT)
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are now open for October 2026 entry (King's PhD Programme in Mental Health Research); The application process for the 2026 intake of the Wellcome Sanger Institute 4-year PhD Programme is now open; The call for applications for a 2026 start are now open (Exeter GW4CAT)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: annual intake of typically not more than five students (per program); Some 39 Wellcome Trust-NIH PhD scholarships have been awarded in the last eight years

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: graduate or student who has, or expects to obtain, a degree (or equivalent); health professionals

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Mental Health Research; scientific research; Molecular, Genetic and Lifecourse Epidemiology; Infectious Diseases; Stem Cell Biology and Medicine; Public Health Economics and Decision Science; Integrative Infection Biology; biological research

academic_requirements.min_gpa: average score through the four/three years is above 60 (GPA above 3.3); minimum upper-second class (2.1) honours

experience_requirements.accepted_types: laboratory rotations; relevant research/work experience; internships outside academia (e.g. healthcare, the media, teaching)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: satisfy standard UCL academic and English language entry criteria; IELTS Academic, TOEFL or Pearson test score as evidence of fluency in English; minimum IELTS score for a PhD is usually 6.5, with at least 5.5 in each part of the exam; minimum TOEFL score for a PhD is normally 90; must have been taken no earlier than two years before the course start date

additional_requirements.reference_letters: referees should state your name and the Wellcome Trust 4-year PhD programme on the reference letter as well as: how they know you, how long they have
additional_requirements.other_requirements: data literate and skilled in the quantitative aspects of biological research

background_and_logistics.application_documents: A covering letter stating clearly that you are applying for the Wellcome Trust four-year; research interests (max 200 words); relevant research/work experience (max 200 words); personal statement; certified proof (for GPA/scores)
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: introduced in 1994; noted for the high-quality postgraduate training they provide; offers postgraduate students collaborative PhD training at academic laboratories in the UK or Republic of Ireland and at the National Institutes; funds PhD programmes that offer graduates outstanding training in scientific research; offer health professionals outstanding research training in supportive and inclusive research environments; innovative science PhD programmes
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Students are recruited annually by the individual programs for uptake in October each year; October 2026 entry; 2026 intake; 2026 start

basic_info.official_name: DAAD Doctoral Programmes in Germany (Research Grants)

funding_info.funding_details: Grant of 861 to 1,200 euros per month (depending on qualifications) plus additional allowances. Funding is provided for a maximum of four years; the length of the funding period is decided by a selection committee and depends on your project and study plan. During a doctorate, funding is available for 2 to 12 months for a research project. Funding must begin in 2026. If necessary, a language course (2, 4 or 6 months) before the start of the research stay in Germany may be funded by DAAD.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 03.09.2025 (for funding starting Wintersemester 2026/27); 31 October 2025 (for One-Year Doctoral Research Grant); 09.09.2025 (for Short-term research grants); 29 August 2025 (for MS and PhD applicants)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Foreign graduates from developed and newly industrialized countries. Applicants must have non-German citizenship and residence outside Germany. Applicants with a Master’s degree (or exceptional Bachelor’s degree) and strong academic records are eligible. Highly qualified doctoral candidates who are early in their academic/professional careers or individuals wishing to earn a doctoral degree in Germany. The scholarship is restricted to certain countries. MS and PhD applicants may apply, with MS being country-specific.

field_restrictions.restrictions: The scholarship for this programme is restricted to certain countries.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: minimum 2.5 on the German scale (roughly 75% or a GPA of 3.0 on the 4.0 scale); a GPA of 9/10 throughout undergraduate studies is also mentioned.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s degree (or exceptional Bachelor’s degree); Doctoral candidates/PhD students

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: German language ability is not a requirement for this grant. Students should demonstrate language skills commensurate with their study and research needs.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters are required, recent and from a university teacher. Reference writers must email their letter directly to bufellow@bu.edu with the reference form or send the signed reference form via email to gradscholar@daad.org or via mail to the DAAD New York office.
additional_requirements.age_limits: maximum age of 32 years (at the time of application) is an additional prerequisite for some programs; however, there is no fixed age limit for all DAAD scholarship programmes, but some specify a maximum time since the last degree.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Research visits outside Germany should constitute no more than one quarter of the anticipated total funding period.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Non-German citizenship and residence outside Germany.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Recommendation Letter, reference form, DAAD application materials.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection takes place in December 2025 (for short-term grants); Selection date in February 2026 (for funding starting Wintersemester 2026/27); Selection date in March 2026 (for funding starting June 2026). The length of the funding period is decided by a selection committee.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: This scholarship programme offers the opportunity to complete a doctoral degree in Germany or to realise a research project in Germany. It provides financial support to cover living expenses, research costs, and health. The scholarships are funded by the German Federal Foreign.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application deadlines are in August/September/October 2025 for funding starting from February 2026, June 2026, or Wintersemester 2026/27. Funding is provided for a maximum of four years for doctoral degrees, or 2 to 12 months for research projects. Funding must begin in 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: UKRI funds doctoral training by awarding training grants to research organisations (ROs), which then support studentships and recruit students. DTPs offer high-quality, coherent postgraduate training. They are flexible awards, providing funding to UK universities to support multiple studentships. MRC DTPs offer significant flexibility in fund use aligned to RO's scientific strategy and strengths, including converting DTP studentships into iCASE studentships and providing an additional flexible supplement for unique training opportunities. All DTP students must be funded at the minimum UKRI stipend level for at least three years and up to a maximum of four years. ESRC-funded PhD studentships through CAM-DTP support 3.5 - 4.5 years of full-time study. Funding for a three-month placement is embedded within the standard PhD model for ESRC studentships. EPSRC DTP funding can support up to 15 Vacation Internships per year, and offers flexibility for up to 10% of students starting in an academic year. The SWDTP offers a Placement Scheme for up to three months' work experience.
covered_expenses: Tuition fees (up to the national UKRI rate for Home students)
Annual maintenance stipend (at minimum UKRI stipend level)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: UKRI studentships are open to international students from the 2021-22 academic year onwards. EU and EEA students are treated as international students unless they have pre-settled or settled status. International students are welcome to apply but may need additional scholarships for remaining fees and immigration costs; they receive a Home rate DTP studentship. Prospective students must apply directly to a DTP or CDT, which will determine eligibility and select students. DTPs and CDTs follow strict internal processes and UK government regulations for residential eligibility. To receive ESRC studentship funding, applicants must have qualifications or experience equal to an honours degree at a first or upper second class level, or a masters from a UK academic research organisation. If a candidate does not meet these specific ESRC criteria, they are treated as an international student. Minimum eligibility for NINE DTP includes completing an undergraduate degree.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Full range of the social sciences (ESRC DTPs). Other research councils (AHRC, BBSRC, EPSRC, MRC, NERC, STFC) also fund DTPs, implying their respective fields.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: First or upper second class honours degree (for ESRC); minimum 2.1 undergraduate degree or equivalent (for E4-DTP).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree (NINE DTP); Honours degree at first or upper second class level or a Masters from a UK academic research organisation (ESRC); Masters degree normally expected (Brunel).

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Relevant work experience may be considered (E4-DTP).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Minimum IELTS 7 for international students (Brunel); Minimum IELTS 6.5 overall or TOEFL (iBT) 90, with each component meeting IELTS 5.5 minimum (MRC TMRP DTP).

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Eligibility for studentship extension due to individual training/research needs or professional placement (AHRC-funded students). Provision for sick pay and medical absence with a Doctor's Note (OOCDTP, CAM-DTP).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: AHRC-funded students must follow UKRI’s open access policy for publishing doctoral research. UKRI must be referenced in written texts like press releases or published documents.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Prospective students must apply directly to a DTP or CDT. Each DTP/CDT has strict internal processes for selecting students, determines applicant eligibility, and decides which students receive funding.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: UKRI Doctoral Training Partnerships (DTPs) are a primary mechanism through which UKRI and its seven research councils (AHRC, BBSRC, EPSRC, ESRC, MRC, NERC, STFC) fund doctoral training in UK universities. DTPs provide grants to research organisations, which then offer studentships. These studentships cover tuition fees (at the UKRI Home rate) and an annual maintenance stipend. They support 3 to 4.5 years of full-time study, often including embedded placements or internships (e.g., 3-month placements for ESRC, up to 15 vacation internships for EPSRC). DTPs offer flexibility to universities, such as converting studentships to iCASE awards or providing supplements for unique training. UKRI studentships are open to international students from AY 2021/22, though international students may need additional funding for fees beyond the Home rate and immigration costs. Specific DTPs have varying numbers of awards (e.g., NERC DTP1 had 240 notional studentships/year, NERC DTP2 had 235 for 2019-20, Southampton DTP has 45 studentships/year).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application deadlines and opening dates vary significantly by individual Doctoral Training Partnership (DTP) and host institution. Applicants are strongly advised to contact the specific DTP or CDT they are interested in for precise application processes and closing dates. Examples of specific deadlines include: Exeter NERC CDT closing 22nd January 2025; MRC Stage two round eight opening 1 May 2025 and closing 16 July 2025. A UKRI webpage closing date of 25 March 2025 was mentioned by one DTP, but applicants are still directed to institutional deadlines.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: Between 1,500 and 1,800 scholars are selected annually globally.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Chevening Scholarships are for outstanding emerging leaders and talented professionals from all over the world who have been identified as potential future leaders. Applicants must meet Chevening's eligibility criteria. Scholars are required to return to their country of origin for two years after completing their studies and are ineligible to apply for a Graduate visa or other visa categories that would allow them to remain in the UK. Employees, former employees, or relatives of an employee of His Majesty’s Government (including FCDO, British Embassies/High Commissions, Home Office, Ministry of Defence, Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy, Department for International Trade, UKVI), the British Council, a sponsoring UK university, or a staff member of the Association of Commonwealth Universities are generally ineligible if the employment took place within the last two years from the opening of Chevening applications. If eligible, they cannot receive a Chevening partner award from the organization they are affiliated with.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Open to all academic disciplines (e.g., Public Policy).
field_restrictions.restrictions: Eligible courses must be full-time, taught master's programs, start in autumn, lead to a master's degree, based in the UK, and not part-time or less than 9 months. Any accredited UK university is eligible, including Oxford, Cambridge, LSE, UCL, Queen Mary University of London, University of Glasgow, University of Strathclyde.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Chevening does not require any particular GPA. Applicants need an undergraduate degree and must secure admission for an eligible master's program. While Chevening itself has no GPA requirement, scholarships based on GPA usually require 3.5+ GPA, making it extremely unlikely but not impossible to get a scholarship with a lower GPA (e.g., 2.92 or 3.06 out of 5).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Applicants must have a bachelor's degree or equivalent. The scholarship supports one-year master’s degrees.

experience_requirements.min_years: A minimum of two years (2,800 hours) of work experience is required.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: All types of work experience are considered, including full-time employment, part-time employment, voluntary work, and paid or unpaid internships.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Chevening no longer requires a separate English test score (e.g., IELTS/PTE). However, applicants must meet the English language requirements of their chosen UK university, which may ask for an English test score.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Applicants are required to submit two reference letters. If advanced to the next stage, these must be provided by the date of the interview. Reference letters should cover: 1) How long the referee has known the applicant, and 2) In what capacity the referee knows the applicant.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Applicants should reflect on their goals and values, create short, medium, and long-term plans, and be specific about how Chevening fits into their career plan.
additional_requirements.age_limits: There is no upper age limit for applying for a Chevening Scholarship.
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: Gender is not a factor in eligibility.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: The scholarship may be rescinded, and applicants banned for up to five years, for certain breaches of terms and conditions. There are implied 'exceptional circumstances' for failing to participate in optional events, but these are not detailed.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applications must be submitted online through Chevening’s online application system. It is not a requirement to apply to course choices before submitting the Chevening application. Changes to the application are limited to personal data and do not include changes to essays, course choices, or work experience.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Required application components include eligibility questions, essays, course choices, work experience details, and two reference letters. Applications must be submitted online.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The application process is competitive and challenging. Applicants must answer eligibility questions. If advanced, two reference letters are required by the interview date. Successful applicants are announced in June (e.g., June 2026 for 2026-27 scholars). Historically, over 108,959 applications have been received, with approximately 1,500-1,800 scholars selected annually, placing selected individuals among the top 1% of applicants.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Chevening Scholarships enable outstanding emerging leaders from all over the world to pursue one-year master’s degrees in the UK. It is the UK Government's global scholarship programme. Types include Standard Chevening Scholarships, Chevening SIDS Scholarships, and Chevening ASEAN Scholarships.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2026-27 Chevening Scholarships opened on August 5, 2025, at 12:00 UTC and will close on October 7, 2025, at 12:00 UTC/GMT. From mid-October 2025, the selection process (including interviews) begins. Successful applicants will be announced in June 2026, ready to commence their UK studies in 2026-27.

basic_info.provider: Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship. Grants are offered. Contributions are available. Financial and academic support. €3,000 for 3-month Italian language and culture courses.

timeline_info.application_deadline: 15 January 2026 (for study application); Age limits refer to 'the deadline of this call' (specific date not explicitly stated, but June 9, 1994 and May 16, 1996 are mentioned as birthdate cutoffs for 28-year limit in different calls).
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are now open for the 2025-2026 academic year. Officially opened applications for the 2025–2026 academic year.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: 1000+ Fully Funded / Funded Italy Government Scholarships and University Scholarships (Note: This number may include university-specific scholarships, not solely MAECI grants).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to foreign citizens living abroad and Italian citizens residing abroad (IRE). International students not residing in Italy are eligible. Applicants must be deserving students and meet academic, age, and language criteria, along with other requirements decided by the MAECI.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s Degree, PhD programs, Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) Programs, Italian Language and Culture Courses, Research under academic supervision, Undergraduate/Bachelor’s Degree programs, Short Courses, Training. Fields mentioned include science, art, economics, engineering, or culture.
field_restrictions.restrictions: The grant is incompatible with any other grant offered by the Italian Government or any other Italian public institution, including DSU grants.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Applicants must hold an appropriate academic qualification required to enroll in an Italian University/Institute. A relevant bachelor’s degree is required for Master's programs. A master’s degree is required for Doctoral programs. Prior admission to an Italian PhD program is required for PhD applicants. For Master's Degree, applicants must hold the Bachelor's degree in the applicant's country of origin.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Good CV with experiences and extracurricular activities.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: A certificate of Italian language level is required for Italian-taught courses (minimum B2 CEFR). Candidates enrolled in an Italian language course at a university may submit a certification from a university language teacher. For Language/culture courses, Italian A2 CEFR is required. English proficiency (B2) may be required depending on the program language. Selection is based on knowledge of the Italian or English language, depending on program requirements.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Applicants for Master’s Degree/Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) Programs/Italian Language and Culture advanced Courses must be at least 18 years old and not older than 28 years by the call's deadline (with the sole exception of renewals). For Bachelor’s Degree: ≤ 23 years old. For Master’s Degree: ≤ 28 years old. For PhD: ≤ 30 years old.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: The scholarship can be renewed for the following academic year if students meet performance requirements. Incompatible with any other grant from the Italian Government or public institutions.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants for PhD programs are required to provide a letter of acceptance from the relevant Italian University and meet the entry requirements and academic qualifications established by the University. Applicants must meet specific age and language criteria defined in the official call. Selection is based on academic merit and motivation.

background_and_logistics.official_website: Applications must be submitted exclusively through the Study in Italy portal. The official MAECI website (esteri.it/en/opportunita/borse-di-studio/per-cittadini-stranieri/borsestudio_stranieri/) is also mentioned.
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Candidates typically need to prepare and submit a set of documents to support their eligibility and qualifications, including evidence of previous academic credentials and language skills.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection is based on academic merit, motivation, and knowledge of the Italian or English language. Final rankings are published for scholarship recipients. Having a good CV with experiences and extracurricular activities can improve chances.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship is an esteemed initiative designed to support international students in pursuing higher education in Italy. It aims to foster international cooperation in cultural, scientific, and technological fields, promote the Italian language and culture, support Italy’s economic system, strengthen academic cooperation, and allow students to experience Italy’s rich academic and cultural heritage. It provides financial and academic support, making higher education in Italy more accessible.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The scholarship is offered for the 2025-2026 academic year. Application for scholarship (via email invitation) in February 2026.

covered_expenses: Bench fee per fellowship year is fixed at €3,720
Full reimbursement of travel card cost for commuting to and from work by public transport (train – tram – bus – metro)

timeline_info.number_of_awards: In a past call, 313 PhD fellowships fundamental research and 179 PhD fellowships Strategic Basic Research were awarded.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Supports researchers who have recently graduated and aim to pursue an independent PhD fundamental research project. Open to young and promising researchers/early-stage researchers. Must have obtained/will obtain a master's degree. Candidates must be affiliated to a university in the Flemish Community or to the Evangelical Protestant Faculty. Open to researchers of any nationality. Must not have completed a PhD.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Fundamental Research, Strategic Basic Research. Preferably in Economics (for some FWO PhD Fellowships).
field_restrictions.restrictions: A minimum score of 4 (good) on interdisciplinarity is required to receive funding from a specific panel, but it is not a general requirement to combine interdisciplinarity.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Special PhD fellowship enables persons not employed within scientific research to finish a PhD within 1 year.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applications must be written in English. Awarded based on personal achievement (excellent study results) and/or after submission of a research project.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Project proposal. Interim report (required after awarding).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: PhD fellowship applications are assessed on two main criteria: the project proposal quality and the candidate's potential as a researcher. Includes (online) preselection meetings.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Aims to support early-stage researchers in their development into independent researchers. Allows young researchers to prepare their PhD. Strategic basic research aims to develop strategically thinking and innovation-oriented scientists, focusing on challenging and innovative research that may lead to innovative applications with economic added value.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: 05 December 2024: opening call; 03 March 2025 at 5pm CET: closing call (last application date); 26 May-11 June 2025: (online) preselection meetings; 13 June (likely results/next stage).

basic_info.provider: Spanish Ministry of Science and Innovation, Ministry of Education and Vocational Training (formerly Ministry of Education, Culture and Sport)

funding_info.funding_details: Grants fund predoctoral contracts for 3 to 4 years. Monthly salary between €1,300 and €1,800. Annual grant amount of 17,785 euros, with a fourth year if postdoctoral of 19,000 euros. Offers full financial support.

timeline_info.application_deadline: FPI calls typically have deadlines in October-November; FPU calls typically have deadlines in January-February. Specific dates vary by year and institution (e.g., 1 October 2025 to 15 November 2025 for Deusto FPI; January 17, 2025, to February 14, 2025 for UC3M FPU 2024).
timeline_info.opening_date: FPI calls typically open in October-November; FPU calls typically open in January-February. Specific dates vary by year and institution (e.g., October–November for UPC FPI; January 17, 2025 for UC3M FPU 2024).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to applicants of all nationalities (for FPI) or Spanish/EU country nationality (for FPU). Must hold a university degree and be enrolled or pre-admitted to a doctoral program in a Spanish university.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Wide range of academic fields, including biomedical sciences, neurosciences, oncology, and any area of knowledge.

academic_requirements.required_degree: University degree; enrollment or pre-admission to a doctoral program.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work or research experience (for FPI ICIQ).

additional_requirements.other_requirements: A full Curriculum Vitae (in PDF format) including academic background, work or research experience, and publications.

background_and_logistics.official_website: Official website of the Ministry of Science and Innovation (for FPI) and Ministry of Education and Vocational Training (for FPU).
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Full Curriculum Vitae (in PDF format) including academic background, work or research experience, and publications.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Grants for pre-doctoral contracts for the training of doctors/PhD students, funding research training in doctoral programmes, enabling candidates to obtain a Doctor title and acquire university teaching skills.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Calls for applications are typically published in October–November (FPI) or January-February (FPU). Expected start date of employment: January/February (for some FPI calls).

basic_info.provider: French Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs

funding_info.funding_details: Monthly allowance of €1,181. Does not cover tuition.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International student (non-French citizenship). Must be nominated by a French higher education institution and accepted into a program. The university applies on behalf of the student. Only candidates applying for the first time at the PhD level are eligible. Applicants currently studying in France are eligible but don’t have priority. Open to candidates already enrolled in a doctoral program (joint supervision of dissertation or dual degree). Scholarship duration: Maximum 12 months for recipients entering the second or third year of a doctorate program; Maximum 18 months for recipients entering the first or second year of a doctorate program.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Science and techniques (Biology and health, Ecological transition, Mathematics and digital, Science and engineering); Human and social sciences (French history, language and civilization, Law and political sciences, Economics and management).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Generally, a good GPA is required, often cited as 3.5/4.0 or 15/20 (over the last three academic years).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Not necessarily. Many programs are offered in English, but applicants should confirm language requirements with their chosen institution.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Up to 35 years old (born after March 31st, 1990) for the 2026 program.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Open to candidates already enrolled in a doctoral program (joint supervision of dissertation or dual degree). Applicants currently studying in France are eligible but don’t have priority.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Only candidates applying for the first time at the PhD level and from one educational institution are eligible.

background_and_logistics.selection_process: Students are nominated by a French higher education institution after being accepted into a program. The university sends the application on behalf of the student.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established by the French Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs to enable French higher education institutions to attract top foreign students to enroll in their master’s and PhD programs.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Duration for PhD: Maximum 12 months for recipients entering the second or third year of a doctorate program; Maximum 18 months for recipients entering the first or second year of a doctorate program.

basic_info.study_country: Belgium (specifically the French-speaking community of Belgium, Wallonia)

funding_info.funding_details: FRIA and FRESH Doctoral Grants provide funding for a 4-year doctoral programme. This is in the form of two successive grants: the 1st scholarship for a maximum duration of 27 months at 27,836.40 € (gross annual), and the 2nd scholarship for a maximum duration of 21 months at 29,158.56 € (gross annual).

timeline_info.application_deadline: Applications are accepted once per year. The FRIA call 2025 opened on 02 July 2025, but no closing date is provided in the scraped content for FRIA/FRESH/ASP.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Entry requirements for ASP, FRIA, and FRESH grants are the same as those for third-cycle (doctoral) degree studies. FRESH scholarships are intended for graduates of the university who intend to conduct basic research projects with high societal impact. ASP is for all international students. An applicant may not apply for a FRIA Grant if they have successively received two F.R.S.-FNRS Research Fellow fellowships (ASP + ASP-REN) or two FRESH grants (1st + 2nd Grant). If an applicant has received a FRIA/FRESH grant, the duration is deducted from the maximum possible duration under other FNRS fellowships.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: FRIA scholarships are for fields of research related to industry or agriculture. FRESH scholarships are for basic research projects with high societal impact. Some FRIA grants mention 'Art of...' (incomplete list).

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's degree of 120 ECTS obtained in one of the universities of French-speaking Belgium. Candidates for FRIA grants should have a second degree.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Reference letter from the promoter and reference letters from reference persons are required (as indicated in the Mini-guide for various F.R.S.-FNRS instruments, likely applicable to doctoral fellowships).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Required documents may include Appendices, a Letter of support from the rector of the host university, a Certificate or copy of the Ph.D. diploma and Minutes of the thesis defence (for applicants who will not have their PhD by a specific date), a 'Seal of Excellence Certificate', and accepted publications (as indicated in the Mini-guide for various F.R.S.-FNRS instruments, likely applicable to doctoral fellowships).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Doctoral grants are awarded by the FRIA/FRESH Board of Directors.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Doctoral grants are awarded by the Fund for Scientific Research (FRS–FNRS) for the preparation and presentation of a doctoral thesis. The F.R.S.-FNRS provides grants or fixed-term contracts for doctoral researchers. The purpose of the FRIA scholarship is to complete a PhD in 4 years.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Grants and fellowships typically start on 1st October. FRIA and FRESH Doctoral Grants were awarded on December 12, 2023, and December 13, 2022.

basic_info.provider: State Secretariat for Education, Research and Innovation (SERI) / SEFRI, Swiss Confederation

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship, offering comprehensive support. The scholarship is worth CHF 1,920.-/month.
covered_expenses: Mandatory Swiss health insurance (for non-EU/EFTA awardees)

timeline_info.application_deadline: Between September-December 2025, depending on the Swiss Embassy.
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are open for academic year 2026–2027.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Around 350 highly talented foreign students and researchers annually.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Mainly intended for talented early career researchers from abroad who have already completed their Master's degree. Candidates must hold a relevant Master's degree to pursue a doctoral degree in Switzerland. International students already holding a Master's or PhD degree in any field of study are eligible. Applicants who have previously received funding from a Swiss Government Excellence Scholarship are ineligible to apply for a second scholarship. Applicants must be citizens of a country other than Switzerland.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All disciplines / any field of study.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Research must align with the host institution's expertise.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Cumulative GPA of 3.5 or higher, or a GPA/percentage that meets the minimum requirement set by the scholarship guidelines.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proficiency in the language of instruction or research (German, French, Italian, or English) is required. Applicants must demonstrate proficiency in English or, depending on the program, other languages.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Applicants must have been born after December 31, 1990 (for Research and PhD funding). The age limit is 35.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants who have previously received funding from a Swiss Government Excellence Scholarship are ineligible to apply for a second scholarship.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must demonstrate leadership, community involvement, and academic excellence. A high-quality, original, and feasible research proposal is required, which must align with the host institution's expertise. Candidates are responsible for arranging their own affiliations with a host professor who is willing to supervise their research at one of the Swiss public universities, Federal Institutes of Technology, University of Applied Sciences, or Schools of Music and Arts. An academic supervisor at a Swiss university is required for all scholarship applications. Integration into the team is expected.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Full CV with a list of academic publications and awards, a research proposal (consisting of seven parts), Letter of Recommendation, and a letter of support from a host supervisor.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: The application for a PhD scholarship (including the letter of support from a host supervisor) and the application for admission to a doctoral programme at a Swiss higher education institution are two separate procedures.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Each year, the Swiss Confederation awards Government Excellence Scholarships to promote international exchange and research cooperation between Switzerland and over 180 other countries. The scholarships are aimed at young researchers from abroad who have completed a master’s degree or PhD. Research scholarships are awarded for research or study at all Swiss cantonal universities, universities of applied sciences, the two federal institutes of technology, and four research institutes. The scholarship enables selected applicants to carry out a one-year research project as part of their doctoral studies or to pursue a full PhD at a Swiss higher education institution or recognised research institute.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The scholarship duration is 12 months, renewable for a maximum of 3 years (up to 36 months for PhD students), conditional upon excellent performance.
